column5: Was surfing the boats-for-sale section of craigslist and came across this post. Looks like a US company looking for someone(s) to man their booth at the sportsman show.   Specifically asked for fisherman/women (instead of booth bunnies).  No idea if they're legit or not (i don't know the company at all), but thought i'd post the craigslist link here in case any of you young guys/girls are looking to make some extra dough.  It says $13 an hour (cash)...no idea if negotiable.  http://toronto.en.craigslist.ca/tor/boa/1064530551.html
I suppose it's possible but it doesn't make sense to go through the expense of getting the booth space there and having total strangers there who were hired at the last minute.

Lots of companies hire pretty booth bunnies....they have someone from the company there to be an expert with credibility, and booth bunnies are there to smile, shake hands, and engage the passerbys....
I'm not going to pretend I know all about immigration laws, but I'm sure it's easy/cheaper to hire local in-country people for some of these jobs.

I saw that ad today too! I was thinking about applying, but then the things that they were selling doesn't even look anywhere close to what I would buy myself.  They have this thing where you put onto the back treble of crankbaits and spoons, which supposedly is like a piece that leaves a scent trail. I honestly think this is a gimmick and my crankbaits catch fish just fine without that piece.  BUT, their website does look like they invested a lot of money to design / illustrate their products! Maybe it is a good product!
yes i support Booth Bunnies too

I'm always kinda sceptical with ads that don't reveal alot.  But hey, it's $13 an hour and if that works for someone, go for it.  "Our line is small and sells itself when explained."  Sounds like you'll like have to be demonstrating something...
I f it is thongs, I am in for sure.
Dude....no offense, but I don't wanna see you in a thong!
would be alright if you got to work with their knotty girls  http://www.sciencefishing.com/knotty1.htm
I got a booth job once!  ... it cost me ten and twenty
Good call. They can "tie me up" anytime they want
Say hi to my cousin Julie at the MNR boot.
